hints.content: For fractions to be equivalent, they must represent the same area of the whole.
Let's use a visual model to see which fractions shade the same area of the whole as $\blueD{\dfrac{2}{3}}$.

![rectangle with 2 of 3 equal parts shaded, with each part labeled 1 third. same sized rectangle below it, with 4 of 6 equal parts shaded, each labeled with 1 sixth](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/45cd2b1ea272856ed0e037912fe0c6c3a2fffa7e)

$\blueD{\dfrac{2}{3}} = \greenD{\dfrac{4}{6}}$

![rectangle with 2 of 3 equal parts shaded, with each part labeled 1 third. same sized rectangle below it, with 7 of 8 equal parts shaded, each labeled with 1 eighth](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/964c7d26760f2264af1b581ef5af14fd2f2ffadb)

$\blueD{\dfrac{2}{3}} \neq \maroonD{\dfrac{7}{8}}$

![rectangle with 2 of 3 equal parts shaded, with each part labeled 1 third. same sized rectangle below it, with 3 of 4 equal parts shaded, each labeled with 1 fourth](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/4e51bde570550be410ff9bd98ae9f62df9d1a45e)

$\blueD{\dfrac{2}{3}} \neq \purpleD{\dfrac{3}{4}}$

The following fraction is equivalent to $\blueD{\dfrac23}$:

- $\greenD{\dfrac{4}{6}}$

question.content:
**Which of the following fractions are equivalent to $\dfrac23$?**
